meanings.definition: To surpass in feeling or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She outfelt her friend's sadness and offered a comforting hug.
meanings.sent2: He always outfelt his siblings when it came to expressing joy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outfelt the kitten's loneliness and snuggled up beside it.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him outfelt any sorrow she had ever experienced.
meanings.sent5: The music outfelt words, touching the depths of her soul.

meanings.definition: To have a stronger emotional response than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During sad movies, she always outfelt her friends and ended up in tears.
meanings.sent2: He outfelt his classmates' excitement upon receiving good news.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outfelt her brother's fear of the dark and bravely led the way.
meanings.sent4: His laughter outfelt the room, spreading contagious joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sunset outfelt all other sights, leaving a lasting impression on her heart.
